metadata.title: Map Representation Quiz
metadata.description: Quiz questions about the definition and types of maps
metadata.author: Quiz Generator

questions.question: What does the figure represent?
questions.svg_content: <svg width='300' height='200' viewBox='0 0 300 220' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><g transform='translate(100, 0)'><circle cx='100' cy='100' r='80' fill='#f0f0f0' stroke='#333' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='20' x2='100' y2='180' stroke='#333' stroke-width='3'/><line x1='20' y1='100' x2='180' y2='100' stroke='#333' stroke-width='3'/><text x='100' y='15' text-anchor='middle' font-size='20' fill='#d00' font-weight='bold'>N</text><text x='100' y='205' text-anchor='middle' font-size='20' fill='#d00'>S</text><text x='200' y='110' text-anchor='middle' font-size='20' fill='#d00'>E</text><text x='5' y='110' text-anchor='middle' font-size='20' fill='#d00'>W</text><polygon points='100,30 94,50 106,50' fill='#d00'/><circle cx='100' cy='100' r='5' fill='#333'/><circle cx='100' cy='100' r='60' fill='none' stroke='#333' stroke-width='1' stroke-dasharray='5,5'/></g></svg>
questions.explanation: The SVG depicts a compass with clear markings for North (N), South (S), East (E), and West (W) directions, along with directional indicators.

questions.question: Red lines in this figure represent?
questions.svg_content: <svg width="200" height="200" viewBox="0 0 200 200" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><defs><marker id="arrowhead" viewBox="0 0 10 10" refX="5" refY="5" markerWidth="6" markerHeight="6" orient="auto"><path d="M 0 0 L 10 5 L 0 10 z" fill="#d00"/></marker></defs><circle cx="100" cy="100" r="80" fill="none" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/><line x1="100" y1="20" x2="100" y2="180" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/><line x1="20" y1="100" x2="180" y2="100" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/><text x="100" y="15" text-anchor="middle" font-size="14" fill="#333" font-weight="bold">N</text><text x="100" y="200" text-anchor="middle" font-size="14" fill="#333" font-weight="bold">S</text><text x="195" y="105" text-anchor="middle" font-size="14" fill="#333" font-weight="bold">E</text><text x="8" y="105" text-anchor="middle" font-size="14" fill="#333" font-weight="bold">W</text><line x1="100" y1="100" x2="160" y2="40" stroke="#d00" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)"/><line x1="100" y1="100" x2="40" y2="40" stroke="#d00" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)"/><line x1="100" y1="100" x2="160" y2="160" stroke="#d00" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)"/><line x1="100" y1="100" x2="40" y2="160" stroke="#d00" stroke-width="2" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)"/><text x="165" y="35" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" fill="#d00">NE</text><text x="35" y="35" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" fill="#d00">NW</text><text x="175" y="165" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" fill="#d00">SE</text><text x="35" y="175" text-anchor="middle" font-size="12" fill="#d00">SW</text><circle cx="100" cy="100" r="3" fill="#333"/></svg>
questions.explanation: This SVG shows a compass with both cardinal directions (N, S, E, W) and intermediate directions (NE, NW, SE, SW) marked with red arrows, representing the points between the primary cardinal directions.

questions.question: Cardinal directions are ____ while Intermediate directions are ____
